Dear Ms. Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (866) 685-0006.

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Facility did not follow proper notification procedures after a youth Yes
went AWOL on a home pass.
III. METHODOLOGY
09/22/2021 Special Investigation Intake
2021C0207030
09/22/2021 Special Investigation Initiated - Face to Face
Teams meeting with Chief Administrator, CEO, and Director.
Director acknowledged that notification to DCWL did not occur
related to Youth A's AWOL from his home pass. The Director
previously reported this in an email on 09/21/21.
09/22/2021 Contact - Document Sent
Emails exchanged with the Director, CA and CEO. Pre-exit
findings provided via email.
ALLEGATION:
Facility did not follow proper notification procedures after a youth went AWOL on a
home pass.
INVESTIGATION:
On 09/21/21, the complainant reported that there was a resident who did not return
from AWOLP. The report was sent to DCWL central office for processing and was
opened for investigation.
In an email from the Director on 09/21/21, the Director reported that the youth failed
to return to Lincoln Center on 9/11/21 from his reintegration visit. The Director
indicated that an incident report and MiSACWIS report were completed, and noted, ‘I
failed to contact Licensing as I’m covering for Director 2 while he’s on vacation. This
is my mishap.’
Documentation reviewed as part of this investigation:
 Unusual Incident Report Summary
 Home visit documentation
 MiSACWIS AWOLP incident report-submitted 09/13/21
2

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4150 Incident reporting.
(3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent
without legal permission, then the institution shall
immediately report the information to law enforcement, the
parent/legal guardian or next of kin, the licensing authority,
and the referring agency.
ANALYSIS: The facility is in violation of the rule and acknowledged that
while one Director was temporarily out and another covered his
duties, the notification of AWOLP in this case was not
completed timely as required. Technical Assistance was
provided in the facility’s last renewal report that all AWOLPs,
including those of youth who do not return from home passes,
must be reported to all individuals in the licensing rule, which
includes notification to licensing.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility submitting an
acceptable corrective action plan for the noted violation.
